content.description:
Bouldery start. Solid 5.9+ moves but with good ledges for shakes.

The bolted line just left and downhill of Castle Anthrax.
8 bolts to chains

Good climbing up mostly juggy terrain leads to slightly smaller holds at the top.

On the main Blob Rock formation this is the farthest right sport route at the top of the scree hill.
9 bolts to anchors

The extension for "Incomplete" which involves small holds that face the wrong direction. 

Climb "Incomplete" as inefficiently as you would like and then sit down at the anchor ledge and recover. Take off your shirt and get in 5.13 mode, it's boulder time!

Clip the first draw on the extension (unclip the "Incomplete" anchors) and move straight into a short, technical boulder followed by a brief section of bucket slamming to the chains. 

2nd clip is strenuous, a long draw helps. 



See "Incomplete", line goes up the middle of the severe overhang all the way to the top.

11 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners. (Extension is only 3 QDs, + 1 that you unclip off of the Incomplete anchor)

Starts on the right side of the wall. Goes up 9 bolts to the top. Don't traverse left and get on the 5.9 towards the top.  Some tricky moves low, but the crux is at the top. 

9 bolts

Start in the groove on the centre-right side of blob rock (slightly up the scree facing the trail). The moves between the first and second bolts (both on your left) are the crux of the climb. Clip a third bolt on your left before trending left over a ledge and continue up a corner to the left. The route traverses significantly to the left (any bolt lines going immediately up are harder climbs)



Centre-right of blob rock. Walk halfway up the scree and look for the obvious groove with three bolts on the left side.

Bolted with bolted anchor

Step up onto a ledge and follow a right facing corner up to heavily chalked, staggered rail by the second bolt. Even though you probably haven't done a 5th class move yet, it's a good place to shake out and chalk up. 

Business time; traverse right along the rail until you're under the 3rd bolt on progressively smaller holds to steeper rock and then move up. Pull a mini boulder to gain a decent rest, then you're straight into the first crux. If a hold is covered in chalk, it's probably good. Too bad that next chalk covered hold is so far away- high feet and a big move!

Continue up through much easier rock for a few meters to yet another gap in the chalk stains. Yet again, high feet and a big move, remarkably similar to the first crux!

Pull up onto the finishing ledge, have a sit down rest and consider continuing up!

Draw beta:

Skip bolt 1, alpine draw bolt 2- make sure you go gates out, the hanger twists
High clip bolt 3 to avoid a slightly odd but not hard rose clip
Skip bolt 4, 1 more easy move gets you to the resting/clipping hold for bolt 5



Severe overhang on the left side of Blob Rock- starts from just above the first boulder in the gully (look for the right facing corner with lots of chalk). High, but safe first bolt, bolt line traverses slightly right. 

7 bolts, biner + cold shut anchor

Yard on horribly uncomfortable holds with no feet off the deck. Traverse hard right to hit the mega-flake. Pull through a mini-boulder and step around the arete onto a no-hands rest ledge. Victory climbing to the chains. 

Just kidding, you're about to get turbo-boxed on another horribly uncomfortable boulder. 



Shared start with Whine/Missing Link (first 2 bolts, just left of the low roof under the arete). Follow the bolts right, and then up the arete. 

8 bolts, chains with biners

Blob rock has a few good moderate (in the 10s) climbings on good solid rock.   The majority of the climbs are sport - the cleaning of the routes is easily scene, hence the more popular routes can be identified.
